RESOLVED_ENTITIES.this segment: segment of Interstate 35 near Moore, Texas

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate 35 near Cotulla, Texas: location where border patrol agents stopped Maria De Jesus Garcia's vehicle and a common smuggling route
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographical boundary relevant to the case and location of the incident, reference point for distance
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.segment of Interstate 35 near Moore, Tex: specific segment of highway known for alien smuggling activity
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court where the trial of Maria De Jesus Garcia took place, the jury deliberated, and post-verdict discovery was denied, also made oral findings of fact regarding the constitutionality of the stop and search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.camper: vehicle used to transport illegal aliens, with a compartment searched for evidence, often heavily loaded and with fogged windows, driven by an unknown person, occupants attempting to hide from view, traveling at slow speed late at night on Interstate 35, found to have 14 additional males lying down on the floor, subject of a suppression motion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia's vehicle: vehicle searched for undocumented aliens, with several passengers admitting to being undocumented and others hiding within the camper compartment, noted for having a heavy or overloaded condition, stopped by border patrol agents Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron
